title: Arab Kingdom of Syria
summary: The Arab Kingdom of Syria (Arabic: المملكة العربية السورية‎, al-Mamlakah al-‘Arabīyah as-Sūrīyah) was a self-proclaimed, unrecognized state that began as a "fully and absolutely independent... Arab constitutional government" announced on 5 October 1918 with the permission of the British military,[1] gained de facto independence as an "Emirate" after the withdrawal of the British forces from OETA East on 26 November 1919,[2] and was proclaimed as a Kingdom on 8 March 1920.
